meanings.definition: To keep in existence or continuance; preserve
meanings.sent1: She maintained her friendship with Sarah for many years.
meanings.sent2: The old lighthouse was maintained by a dedicated group of volunteers.
meanings.sent3: Despite the chaos, he maintained a calm demeanor throughout the storm.
meanings.sent4: The tradition of storytelling has been maintained through generations.
meanings.sent5: The gardener maintained the beautiful flowers with care and attention.

meanings.definition: To keep in a certain condition; keep up
meanings.sent1: He maintained his car by regularly changing the oil.
meanings.sent2: The janitor maintained the cleanliness of the school hallways.
meanings.sent3: Even with limited resources, she maintained the quality of her work.
meanings.sent4: The athlete maintained a steady pace throughout the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The chef maintained the perfect balance of flavors in the dish.

meanings.definition: To support or defend in speech or argument
meanings.sent1: She maintained her position in the debate with strong evidence.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer maintained his client's innocence throughout the trial.
meanings.sent3: Despite the criticism, he maintained his belief in the project.
meanings.sent4: The teacher maintained that honesty is always the best policy.
meanings.sent5: The scientist maintained his theory despite skepticism from colleagues.
